page.title: 18Farming near Guisborough II
page.content: Foxdale Farm is 110 feet above s.l.& has 176 acres(the largest of our 4 farms).It was established in the M.Ages,but redeveloped in 1860.The family has lived there for 84 years. They keep cattle (20 heffers) & 50 sheep plus 100 acres of cereal & 70 of grass.The farmer we spoke to spent most of the time complaining about the public.A pub. footpath runs across the land & people trespass off it.Also they dump rubbish where land has been cleared.The farmer gets govt.concess- ions for'fat'lambs & cattle. He is concerned about inflation:a tractor cost Â£100 before the war & now Â£36000. Another very old farm nearby is Bel- mont Farm (170 acres).They have 120 ewes,300 pigs & bullocks to fatten. Usual rotation is wheat to barley to oil seed rape (which cleans the soil).
